AUC-ROC): Prone to overfitting; interpretable; sensitive to small changes in data
Assumes linear relationship; simple and interpretable; performs well on small datasets
Non-parametric; sensitive to feature scaling and outliers; prediction requires storing all training data
Works well in high-dimensional spaces; kernel choice affects performance; not ideal for very large datasets
Flexible and powerful; requires tuning many hyperparameters; can overfit on small datasets
Ensemble of decision trees; reduces overfitting; robust to noise and outliers

F1-score: Unsupervised clustering; not suitable for classification tasks; sensitive to cluster initialization
